data.name: Functional programming in JS/TS -  Part 3: Filtering Arrays iteratively
data.description:
Like projection, filtering an array is also a very common operation. To filter an array we apply a test to each item in the array and collect the items that pass into a new array.

Like in Part 1, we will make a first attempt at filtering using `forEach()`: this kata is about implementing a `filterWithRatingHigherOrEqualThan()` function which returns only the videos with a rating above or equal to the specified number.

In the following kata, we'll see how to generalize this implementation into a `filter()` function.

## Note: Attribution
This kata is part of a series on functional programming in JS/TS. This series is an adaptation of the *Functional Programming in Javascript* online exercises: http://reactivex.io/learnrx/ (Apache 2 license).
